positive.review:
The best entry in the Tekken franchise in a few years.
Bonus point for the Modding Community for being able to have legendary matchups like Juggernaut VS Gon

Love this game. Never even touched online, which is probably why I love it. Tekken Bowling is an old time favourite of mine. Customisation could be a little better and many of the clothes just look really bulky. Decent roster.  Tekken is always the best game for the most rich move lists.

Love playing this game, playing multiplayer is always a good time as well as just fighting endlessly with the practice bot. Also there are a lot of stories too of every character. Overall one of the best fighting games

Its very fun to play with other characters but my favourite character is devil Jin. There are  many moves set that are hard to learn but if you learn them you are a true gamer. I really loved this game. Tekken 8 is more amazing but this game is also have a match with tekken 8. Amazing graphics, story mode, online mode etc.

Story Mode is peak, but online is kinda bleak.

If you get a player its fun tho

Tekken 7 gets a lot of hate but I enjoy it a lot. It was a little bare on release but has quite a lot more content now, even Tekken Bowling makes a return. The story picks up from where 6 left off but ends with an amazing showdown between Heihachi and Kazuya and eventually Akuma from Street Fighter. That probably sounds stupid but they actually make it work lol.

This is the first Tekken game to not introduce any cool new characters aside from Kazumi. I for one have always wanted to see Kazuya‚Äôs mother and her appearance here is very epic as is her devil form and boss fight. Using a tiger in her move set is just beyond awesome. Beyond that though the new characters are all flops. Super uninteresting, nothing characters. Especially Noctis, waste of a guest slot.

We‚Äôre never going to get another game as good as Tekken Tag Tournament 2 or Tekken 5 but what‚Äôs here is still enjoyable and I‚Äôm just glad that Tekken still exists in today‚Äôs world even if it has succumbed to the fate of being FGC slop. I‚Äôm also glad Harada is still a working man in the industry, he‚Äôs one of the last great game designers of old. And yes, there are super moves in this one that function as a comeback mechanic. Makes me miss the days of rage mode in Tekken 6.

I played the Xbone version at launch but played the Steam port much later. Had a lot of fun with both and they run great. Online modes never gave me much trouble either.

Also bonus points for any Tekken game that brings back Anna. Best character in the series, thank you Namco.

the game is an interesting  game to play, I like the idea to play with the customization of the characters and you have a hole lot of characters to play. and I also.... you have a different range of characters to play around with. if you looking something beginner friendly I suggest getting Tekken 8 game.

Honestly, Tekken 7 surprised me in a good way. The gameplay feels really smooth, and once you get the hang of your main character, it becomes super addictive. Every hit has weight, combos feel satisfying, and the roster has a good mix of characters for different playstyles.

Online matches can be tough at first, but improving is actually fun, and you can really feel the difference as you learn. The story mode is decent too, especially if you‚Äôve followed the Mishima family drama.

Overall, I‚Äôve enjoyed my time with it a lot. Whether you‚Äôre new to fighting games or already familiar with Tekken, this one is definitely worth playing.

Love the game. Pretty worth it for the price even now if you want to mostly play offline.

Online is kinda dead, takes forever to find a match, if you just started than even so.

Seeing my old favorites return, feeling the same rush during close fights, and experiencing the evolution of the franchise made Tekken 7 more than just a game. For me, it was a beautiful mix of nostalgia and modern gameplay.

Probably the last legacy-ish Tekken game with how the series is progressing so far, still has a online presence through-out low ranks if you want to play Tekken for the first time but don't have enough to get the latest installment this game still holds up gameplay wise graphically doesn't hold up
fighting addict and a game i enjoy playing for fun on my free time offline i for sure prefer this one over 8
It is a good game when you play 1v1 with friends but when you play alone and you have  play all the story it is starting to getting boring.
very nice game. i see myself hating this for being too repetitive in about 2 years
this is the best game  in 3d fighting genre and no other game can match the technicality of tekken.

6/10 - Recommended but only on sale.  Tekken 3 is still better.

NAMCO, I waited 8 years until your $110 game went on sale before I bought it.  You ask too much and offer too little to the player.  I will see you for Tekken 8 in 2032. 

I am 45 years old and I grew up in the days when teh arcade mode was the #1 attraction. I do not want to play online. The arcade mode is 5 matches long. It's disgusting. These games are not made for people who only want to play single player. Us old guys will always regard Tekken 3 as the best ever for good reason. Graphics don't matter. There was so much extra the NAMCO put in that game for ONE price that it was playable for a long time without online.

These days, every fighting game puts bare minimum into the single player game that it's not worth buying, especially when all in you're generally looking at well over $100. Street Fighter and Dead or Alive want like $300 for the full game. Tekken doesn't even bother to give you an ending (outside of credits) in the arcade mode anymore. 

Tekken 7 is decent. The graphics look nice and they haven't yet added annoying moves that trigger a cut scene in the middle of a match like Tekken 8.  The treasure mode is "meh."  You fight random fights and wins silly cosmetic things. I'd rather have a full-fledged arcade mode or a stiry mode where you can fight with your selected fighter and play through and get an unique ending with that character. 

Online is the worth thing to happen to fighting games.  Honestly, you could sell me the full game for $70 with all the characters and stages and sell the online portion for another $30-40 and I'd be happy as hell. If you're going to piece meal the game, let the players decide what features they want to keep the price reasonable and not buy the junk they don't want.

NAMCO, I will gladly pay $100 for your fighting game but don't confuse me with all your piece meal editions and put a proper arcade mode back in with unlockable characters earned through playing the game.  I don't mind it you want to keep characters that require a licensing deal behind a pay wall but not standard Tekken characters, please.
Great tekken game. One of the best tekken games you can play. Sadly the balancing has be thrown out the window in the last seasons

Im favorite pvp game, im a fan of tekken since im still a kid, my favorite marshall law is my best character, aggressive and perfect combo. If you want to play a perfect pvp game i want you to buy this and play it
Fast paced and pretty cool! Learning and using new combos for each character is extremely fun.

Tekken 7 is a 3D fighting game that concludes the long-running clash between Heihachi Mishima and his son Kazuya, framing its battles within a story of power, betrayal, and generational conflict. The narrative is presented through cinematic cutscenes and character vignettes, combining dramatic escalation with a grounded perspective from an investigative journalist. While the story is concise, it provides clear context for the series‚Äô central feud.

Combat builds on Tekken‚Äôs established foundation of precise movement, whiff punishment, and character-specific stances. The game introduces two key mechanics‚ÄîRage Art and Rage Drive‚Äîthat give players powerful options when their health is low. These tools add comeback potential without overshadowing traditional fundamentals, allowing both new and experienced players to engage with the system effectively.

The roster includes a wide selection of returning characters alongside newcomers who bring distinct styles. Fighters such as Shaheen, Claudio, and Katarina introduce accessible entry points, while returning veterans retain the depth and complexity expected by long-time fans. Each character features a large movelist, enabling diverse playstyles and long-term mastery.

Stages are designed with interactive elements such as breakable floors, walls, and balcony transitions. These features allow players to extend combos or shift the momentum of a match, adding strategic layers to positioning. Visual themes range from industrial arenas to mystical temples, contributing to the atmosphere without compromising clarity during fights.

Online play uses rollback-inspired delay-based netcode, providing generally stable matches but with noticeable variation depending on connection quality. Ranked, player match, and tournament modes give structure to online engagement. Offline options‚Äîincluding arcade battles, treasure hunts, and customizable practice tools‚Äîoffer consistent ways to refine skills and unlock cosmetic items.

Customization is extensive. Players can modify character outfits, accessories, and effects, giving the roster significant visual variety. While purely aesthetic, this system adds long-term goals outside of competitive progression and allows players to personalize their fighters within the game‚Äôs style framework.

Tekken 7 succeeds through its precise mechanics, broad roster, and balanced introduction of new systems. Its mix of accessibility and depth supports both casual play and high-level competition. For players seeking a polished, technical 3D fighter with strong character identity and refined gameplay, it remains one of the defining entries in the Tekken series.

I hopped back into Tekken 7 recently, and it still holds up really well. The gameplay is tight, fast, and super satisfying once you get your combos down. The roster is huge, so there‚Äôs always a new character to learn (or get destroyed by). Online can be hit or miss depending on who you match with, but when you get a good connection, the fights feel great.

On my RTX 4050 + Ryzen 7 HP Victus, it runs perfectly ‚Äî 160+ FPS on high settings without any dips. This game is not very demanding, so it stays smooth no matter what‚Äôs happening on screen.

Pros

‚úî Fast, satisfying and intense combat
‚úî Massive roster with lots of variety
‚úî Great for both casuals and grinders

Cons

‚úò Online experience depends heavily on connection quality
‚úò Learning advanced combos can be tough
‚úò Story mode is decent but not amazing

Overall: Tekken 7 is still one of the best fighting games out there. Super fun, easy to get into, hard to master ‚Äî and it runs like butter on my laptop.
A beautifully brutal fighter‚Äîequal parts hype and heartbreak.
Amazing actions and characters. Nice combos and engaging online mode
Graphics of this is amazing and before moving to tekken 8 I would recommend to play T7 first so that you learn about spacing, punishment and defense.

Anyway, until they add Bob, Ganryu, and Lei in Tekken 8, I am gonna stay here.

Stay away from this game to save yourself of money and stress.

After playing many fighting games,

This one just doesn't stand out to me.
Nothing special about the characters or gameplay
Feels like the run of the mill arcade game you'd find anywhere, a real button masher

Idk how this series got so popular but I will not be buying another Tekken game after this

Overall: 0/5 
Graphics: dated
Gameplay: Outshined by literally any other fighting game; Mortal Kombat, Injustice, Dead Or Alive
Characters: Honestly, very lame & un-memorable
UI: sucks
Music: meh
Transition Screen between matches is particularly notable for being trash

I don't know what i expected form a fighting game, got baited by the co-op slop.
Fighting games will always be shit.

As a new player, it's a torture cycle.
1. I get destroyed by an enemy character
2. I go into practice tool and learn everything I can about how to counter them
3. I get destroyed by another enemy character
4. Repeat until you forgot what you learned in practice tool
5. Meet the character you practiced again only to realize you forgot everything. You get destroyed again.

Implrement a ban system or something. Make me wait longer, but allow me to narrow down who I meet. At least at low ranks.

i really like the game but i hate how the game asks u to buy dlcs for the smallest things which should be granted to have by default as example u need to pay for a dlc to display ur frame rate which i think is just greedy and really unfair.

haven't played this series since 5. decided to catch up. I can see it went down hill.  game is pay walled which is obviously a no no. besides that, feels like a chore to play. it honestly doesn't FEEL like a Tekken game and is a shell of the former imo.

Went from one of the top games straight to the bottom. Full of cheaters, trash player quality , they just learn 3 moves and spam those over and over, you only ever see 3 characters in ranked, you can play for hours and only get matched with the same 2 cheaters you did the previous day. Tekken was once one of my favorite games in the world, i have been playing it since tekken 2, but now, the ranked experience is so bad, i can't even dare to recommend this to anyone. It's still fun to play with friends, but otherwise it's just not fun. You'll be wasting your time with lag hackers wishing for the match to end faster so you can log out.

haven't played this series since 5. decided to catch up. I can see it went down hill.  game is pay walled which is obviously a no no. besides that, feels like a chore to play. it honestly doesn't FEEL like a Tekken game and is a shell of the former imo.

The game feels very empty, I enjoyed the main story but I think they could make it better by introducing more characters to the narrative or just made it longer. 

I did not like the side characters stories, with exception of some, most were just gags and again very short, basically adding nothing to the game, which is a shame, because I really liked the story of characters like Miguel and Steve Fox, and it would be awesome if they gave them more attention. 

The customization is very terrible, super limited and not fun at all.

Not recommended if you plan playing only for story / offline mode.
